Trajectory warm up¶

Contents

  • Trajectory warm up
    • Register to load from disk
    • Register to load from disk with frame stride
    • Register to load several files from disk
    • Register to load several files from disk with frame stride
    • Fancy indexing
    • Iterate whole trajectory
    • Iterate a part of trajectory
    • Do computing
    • Convert data to pandas DataFrame

Register to load from disk¶

In [1]: import pytraj as pt

In [2]: traj = pt.iterload('tz2.nc', 'tz2.parm7')

In [3]: traj
Out[3]: 
pytraj.TrajectoryIterator, 101 frames: 
Size: 0.000503 (GB)
<Topology: 223 atoms, 13 residues, 1 mols, non-PBC>

Register to load from disk with frame stride¶

# start=0, stop=8, step=2
In [4]: pt.iterload('tz2.nc', tz2.parm7', frame_slice=(0, 8, 2))
  File "<ipython-input-4-4b1693f12f16>", line 1
    pt.iterload('tz2.nc', tz2.parm7', frame_slice=(0, 8, 2))
                                                            ^
SyntaxError: EOL while scanning string literal

Register to load several files from disk¶

In [5]: pt.iterload(['tz2.0.nc', 'tz2.1.nc'], tz2.parm7')
  File "<ipython-input-5-36a9f10b9b45>", line 1
    pt.iterload(['tz2.0.nc', 'tz2.1.nc'], tz2.parm7')
                                                     ^
SyntaxError: EOL while scanning string literal

Register to load several files from disk with frame stride¶

In [6]: pt.iterload(['tz2.0.nc', 'tz2.1.nc'], tz2.parm7', frame_slice=[(0, 8, 2), (0, 5, 1)])
  File "<ipython-input-6-a4a456e24d6f>", line 1
    pt.iterload(['tz2.0.nc', 'tz2.1.nc'], tz2.parm7', frame_slice=[(0, 8, 2), (0, 5, 1)])
                                                                                         ^
SyntaxError: EOL while scanning string literal

Fancy indexing¶

In [7]: traj[0]
Out[7]: <Frame with 223 atoms>

In [8]: traj[:2]
␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Out[8]: 
pytraj.Trajectory, 2 frames: 
Size: 0.000010 (GB)
<Topology: 223 atoms, 13 residues, 1 mols, non-PBC>
           

In [9]: traj[:2, '@CA']
␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Out[9]: 
pytraj.Trajectory, 2 frames: 
Size: 0.000001 (GB)
<Topology: 12 atoms, 12 residues, 12 mols, non-PBC>

Iterate whole trajectory¶

In [10]: for frame in traj:
   ....:     pass
   ....: 

In [11]: frame
Out[11]: <Frame with 223 atoms>

Iterate a part of trajectory¶

  • with stop value
In [12]: for frame in pt.iterframe(traj, stop=5):
   ....:     print(frame)
   ....: 
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
  • with given frame indices
In [13]: for frame in pt.iterframe(traj, frame_indices=[0, 5, 20, 50]):
   ....:     print(frame)
   ....: 
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
<Frame with 223 atoms>
  • with given mask
In [14]: for frame in pt.iterframe(traj, frame_indices=[0, 5, 20, 50], mask='@CA'):
   ....:     print(frame)
   ....: 
<Frame with 12 atoms>
<Frame with 12 atoms>
<Frame with 12 atoms>
<Frame with 12 atoms>

Do computing¶

# rmsd to first frame with mask='@CA'
# python starts counting from 0
In [15]: pt.rmsd(traj, ref=0, mask='@CA')
Out[15]: 
array([  1.94667955e-07,   2.54596866e+00,   4.22333034e+00, ...,
         4.97189564e+00,   5.53947712e+00,   4.83201237e+00])

Convert data to pandas DataFrame¶

In [16]: df = pt.multidihedral(traj, resrange='3-7', dtype='dataframe')

In [17]: type(df)
Out[17]: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀␀Out[19]:

Convert to different file format¶

# to DCD format
In [20]: pt.write_traj('traj.dcd', traj, overwrite=True)

Combine with cpptraj commmand style¶

In [21]: pt.do(['rms', 'radgyr @CA', 'distance :3 :7'], traj)
Out[21]: 
OrderedDict([('RMSD_00000',
              array([  2.43182129e-07,   4.01623189e+00,   6.41421043e+00, ...,
                       8.27504991e+00,   8.19405473e+00,   7.77917637e+00])),
             ('RoG_00001',
              array([ 8.10916061,  7.7643485 ,  8.09693108, ...,  6.38061648,
                      6.24139008,  6.48994552])),
             ('RoG_00001[Max]',
              array([ 12.30764509,  12.10928972,  14.3881904 , ...,   9.505607  ,
                       9.45815721,  10.29136723])),
             ('Dis_00003',
              array([ 11.17446726,   8.57430478,   7.40760415, ...,   9.06436275,
                       6.59675   ,   8.63872898]))])
